text: Hello, and welcome to another Nerdy Nummies!

Today I’m gonna be making Dr. Mario Cupcakes!
I was inspired because I was in

a web series that TGS made, and I played Nurse
Joy! I’ll put a link down below

so you can go check it out! It was so much
fun,

I was like, I gotta make cupcakes! So, let’s
get started!

I’ve got my cupcake tray, and I’m gonna
line it with these red cupcake liners.
Because it will look so medical, mmmm!
So bloody!

Before I made the batter for the cupcakes,
using a white box cake, I made

this red cake, by adding red food coloring.
And the reason I did that is

because I really want to, when you cut into
the cupcake, to see a red cross

in the cupcake. I was like, oh! I saw someone
do that with a heart and I was
like, why not do a red cross?

So what we're gonna do is take a square
cookie cutter... And... Push it in.

I stuck this red cake in the freezer for a
little bit so that it would stay firm
and my shapes will stay together.
Like so.
Boop!

And then you take the smaller cookie cutter,
smaller little square,
and you just cut out the corners.

You can use anything that you have handy,
I did not have a cross cookie cutter,

so I’m doing this to improvise. You might
be able to find a plus sign like
in a numbers set, but I couldn't find it. But anyways, that’s what it will look like, this little cross!

We’re gonna make a bunch of these, 1 for
each of the cupcakes.

Now we’re going to assemble these cupcakes,
what you’re gonna do is take a

scoop of the white batter, put it into the
cupcake tray... Like so.

And then you’re gonna take 1 of the crosses,
berp!
And stick it straight down!

And remember which way your crosses are facing
so that when you cut the cupcake,
you’ll see the cross in there.

And you’re just gonna do this for all of
the cupcakes.

And just remember, after you put your cross
in, you’ll take 1 more scoop of

batter, and you’ll put it all around it,
even on top of it!
And do this with all of the cupcakes.

Now you’re gonna put these in the oven, you’re
gonna cook ‘em just like regular

cupcakes. So we're gonna preheat the oven
to 350 and bake for 18-20 minutes.
Mmmm!
Ding! They’re done!
Now, it’s time to decorate.

We’re gonna be making, first, Dr. Mario’s
face and the 3 little sprites.

So for the sprites I have yellow frosting,
blue frosting, red frosting,

and then for Dr. Mario I made this skin color,
I made this all with food coloring.

We’re gonna microwave all 4 of these so
that the frosting gets liquid-y.

And then we’re going to dip the cupcake
in.

We are also going to be making pills out of
Jelly Beans. Yellow jelly bean,
the blue jelly bean, and the red jelly bean.

We’re gonna cut them in 1/2 and then put
the different colors together.

For the red sprite, der-da! We’re gonna
make his little ears and then he

has horns, so, for his ears we’re gonna
take small marshmallows,

and we’re just gonna grab a marhsmallow,
1 of these little guys, and we’re

gonna take baking scissors and 
cut them diagonal.

So it will go just like that and it will look
like little ears!

Then you’re gonna take a toothpick, put
it into the side, and put it on the top.
And do the same for the other side.

Now for the blue sprite, we’re just gonna
dip him and then afterwards cut out his little
eyebrows out of an airhead, a blue airhead!

So just straight down, pick your flattest
cupcake for his face, because the
eyebrows are really big!

Bring it up, let it drip, then you can smooth
it out with a spatula.

Now for Dr. Mario, you’re gonna take your
cupcake, and you’re gonna make his

little ears on the side, with, again, 2 small
marshmallows.

So you’ll take a toothpick, stick it on
the side, then kind of figure out where

you want his little ear to be… I’ll put
him here!

Because in the game, Dr. Mario, his ears stick
out so much!
He has big ears! Just stick it right in there!

And now we’re gonna dip it into skin colored
frosting.

While those cupcakes are cooling, we’re
gonna make the rest of them with just
white frosting, ba-da!
Just frost the top of the white cupcake.

I’m gonna smoothen it out with a spatula,
but I just, I just put it in a
bag to get it out kind of even.

After you’re done smoothing out all the
cupcakes, all the frosting on top,

we’re gonna dip them into white sugar, so
it will make it look really cool!

See, like this. Just dip them in, kind of reminds
me of what they do on, like,

martini glasses. So they look like this. Oooh,
pretty!

Now for the fun part, we’re gonna decorate
all the tops of these white
cupcakes, starting with the pills!

So what you’re gonna want to do I like this,
because it’s fun! You’re gonna

take the yellow jelly beans, the blue jelly
beans and the red jelly beans,

and you’re gonna cut them in 1/2 and pair
them together in any combo you want.

Because in the game they come in all of these
color combos.

And then you’re just gonna stick a few on top
of the cupcake. Merp, let’s get going!

Now I’m gonna decorate 2 more white cupcakes with
things that I made that
were pre-made out of fondant.

Um, here we are! Little stethoscope! I used
black fondant and gray fondant.

And I’m just gonna delicately pick it up.
Eeee!
And place it onto the cupcake.
And press down lightly.

If you don’t have fondant, you can just
use, um, frosting, black frosting

or gray frosting using food coloring. I just
decided to do this to save a
little time and I thought it would be cute!

So there we go! And for then for the next one, I made,
out of fondant, just black.

It says, doctor, but the R has the R-X, er-her-her!
Like in the Dr. Mario logo.
So I’m just gonna place these on the cupcake...
Doctor!

The last white cupcake that I’m gonna be
decorating,
I’m gonna be using the cherry airhead.
This is the 1 that’s red, and we're gonna make a medical cross.
Take baking scissors…

Just gonna cut a little design! And I’m
just kind of eyeballing it,

if it’s not perfect, that’s fine, because
um, airheads and Laffy Taffy, whatever
moldable candy you’re using, they’re moldable,
so you can adjust them as you go.

So I’ve got my basic cross, and then I’m just
going to kinda mold it a little bit to move

it around and make it more even, then just
stick it right on the cupcake.

All the little sprites have their basic color,
but now we’re gonna
start adding details to their face.

Here I have a moon shaped cookie cutter, and
I’m just going to cut out merp!

Into the Laffy Taffy… I shake my Laffy Taffy’s,
I shake my Laffy Taffy.
God that was an old song! I’m so old!
OK, here we go!

Got our little moon. And the sprite’s eyebrowa,
we’re just gonna shape it now.
I’m gonna use my scissor a little bit here.
Cut a little triangle.

2 more little triangles on each side. And
they’re pretty shallow.
Then I’m gonna stick this on top… Bing!

Now I’m gonna decorate the faces with this black
frosting, I’m using a really small
tip, and here we go little sprites!
Der-dew! Dr. Mario Cupcakes!
They turned out so cute! I love it!
I did the Dr. ergh, and then Mario! Eeee!

They’re so cool, and, we even cut one open,
so we cut one of the pill cupcakes

open so you could see what it would look like
inside. And there it is!
There’s our red cross, so it actually works!

This was really fun! You can also do this
with other shapes, like hearts

for Valentines Day or whatever you’d like!
Mmmm!

OK, so if you have any other suggestions for
any other Nerdy Nummies, please

leave me a comment below and I will do my
best to make it happen.
Thanks for watching you guys, bye-bye!
